description: Execute SQL queries against various database types and return structured results.

database_url.info: Database connection URL (for PostgreSQL, MySQL, etc.). Format: dialect://user:password@host:port/database

database_path.info: Path to the SQLite database file.

database_type.info: Type of database to connect to.

sql_query.info: SQL query to execute. Use proper SQL syntax for your database type.

operation_type.info: Type of SQL operation being performed (affects safety checks and output formatting).

return_only_text.info: If true, results will be returned as simple text strings instead of structured data.

include_columns.info: Whether to include column names in the result output.

limit_rows.info: Maximum number of rows to return from the query results.

safe_mode.info: When enabled, prevents execution of potentially destructive operations (DROP, DELETE, etc.).

text_key.info: The key to use for the text field in the Data objects.

success.query_executed: Successfully executed {operation} query and returned {rows} rows

warnings.no_results: Query executed successfully but returned no results

errors.destructive_query_blocked: Potentially destructive query blocked by safe mode. Disable safe mode to execute.
errors.dataframe_error: Error creating DataFrame from query results: {error}
errors.missing_database_path: Database path is required for SQLite connections.
errors.missing_database_url: Database URL is required for this database type.
errors.sqlalchemy_required: SQLAlchemy is required for non-SQLite database connections. Please install it.
